Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Dermaseptin-S9 (DRS-S9, Dermaseptin S9, DRS S9, natural AMPs; UCLL1; frog, amphibians, animals; BBBh2o)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: inhibited Human Immunodeficiency Virus Type 1 HIV-1 (EC50 31.6 uM), SARS-CoV-2 (de Amaral M, Ienes-Lima J., 2022). Also, this peptide can form amyloid-like structure (Amyloid AMPs) (Caillon et al., 2013;Landreh et al., 2014).Chemotactic: Drs S9 can induce the migration of immune cells such as neutrophils, T lymphocytes and monocytes.MOA: acted on membranes.Toxicity: TC50 >32.9 uM in CEM-SS cells (Wang G et al. 2010 Antimicrob. Agents Chemother. 54: 1343-1346).Structure: Residues 6-21 are helical in TFE.
Literature Information.Author: Lequin O et al Amiche M2006
Literature Information.Title: Dermaseptin S9, an alpha-helical antimicrobial peptide with a hydrophobic core and cationic termini
